title: Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort, Morocco triumphs at the 22nd Annual World Travel Awards
text:
Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort, Morocco triumphs at the 22nd Annual World Travel Awards Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort, Morocco triumphs at the 22nd Annual World Travel Awards Details Category: Awards   12:30 For the second year running, Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort is delighted to take home the awards for Africa’s Leading MICE Hotel and Morocco’s Leading MICE Hotel, as well as being awarded as Africa’s Leading Casino Resort at the 22nd Annual World Travel Awards. The World Travel Awards works to acknowledge, reward and celebrate excellence across all sectors of the tourism industry. The World Travel awards are recognised globally as the ultimate hallmark of quality. 
The final show is scheduled to be held on 12 December 2015 at Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort. Mazagan provides the ideal setting to host team building events meetings, conferences and seminars. Housing state of the art conference facilities, the 2000m2 conference centre includes divisible plenary rooms, a boardroom, numerous committee rooms and spacious, private gardens. Heralded as Morocco’s largest and most exclusive casino, and the most beautiful casino in North Africa, Mazagan’s Casablanca Casino features over 500 slot machines and gaming tables, as well as a wide variety of well known card games, over a 3000 m2 space. Private gaming is also an option. Located on seven-kilometre of private beach along the Atlantic Ocean, Mazagan ensures that groups will receive a memorable team building experience. Activities range from horse riding and quad biking along the beach, to paint balling and archery. Guests can also unwind in the 19 treatment-roomed spa, before sitting down for an authentic Moroccan banquet at Morjana, seating up to 250 people or Al Firma for an al fresco dining experience. President of Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort, Stephan Killinger comments: “We are delighted to accept these three prestigious. We have worked hard to become one of the countries leading resorts for meetings and conferences, and we aim to continue to perfect our facilities and offerings to welcome our guests back year after year.” Related articles
